title: (x) chrome-looking typeface - Quicksilver {Lex}
content:
I know this ones really easy, i just cant remember the name. I went searching for it thinking it was called hot dog but that didn't return the right one...

Used to hate this font, I guess it's gone so bad it's cool again :)
author: xen

comments.content: Xen, we need a sample or a link.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20101212230921im_/http:/typophile.com/files/line-mothership.jpg)

Sorry, i browsed for it, just forgot this forum doesn't upload automatically when posting :)

[Check this old thread for more info.](http://web.archive.org/web/20101212230921/http:/72.14.203.104/search?q=cache:CKRd3vdSA1wJ:www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/39739.html%3F1088705824+quicksilver+letraset&hl=en&gl=ca&ct=clnk&cd=1)

- Lex

No problem.

Oh, and the "hot dog" font you were thinking of is probably [Frankfurter](http://web.archive.org/web/20101212230921/http:/www.fontshop.com/?fuseaction=catalog.fontpackage&searchby=manufacturer&displayfontid=ITC.100337.0.0) which has a highlighted version that looks similar to Quicksilver.

- Lex

Funny, today I stumbled upon a font I knew existed a long while ago - but remembered this thread. So because the font Quicksilver digitally is difficult to come by if at all, I found Neon Lights [http://www.dafont.com/neon-lights.font?text=PMC](http://web.archive.org/web/20101212230921/http:/www.dafont.com/neon-lights.font?text=PMC "http://www.dafont.com/neon-lights.font?text=PMC") -- and thought I'd update this thread if someone else was in need of help trying to find a font to match.
